title: Fix Karigar and generic name display in dashboard

requirements.text: Ensure Karigar names (karigarName field) display correctly in all dashboard tabs (Total Orders, Ready Orders, Hallmark Orders, Customer Orders) when rendering order rows in OrderTable component

quotes: the app is not able to display exact Karigar names and generic names across the orders in the dashboard

acceptanceCriteria: Karigar names appear in all order rows across all dashboard tabs
Karigar names match the values stored in the order records
No null or undefined values appear where Karigar names should display

requirements.text: Ensure generic names (genericName field) display correctly in all dashboard tabs when rendering order rows in OrderTable component

quotes: the app is not able to display exact Karigar names and generic names across the orders in the dashboard

acceptanceCriteria: Generic names appear in all order rows across all dashboard tabs
Generic names match the values stored in the order records
No null or undefined values appear where generic names should display

requirements.text: Verify that order filtering logic in TotalOrdersTab and ReadyTab preserves karigarName and genericName fields when filtering by status, order type, or karigar selection

quotes: Version 41 added logic to filter orders by status
The filtering/splitting logic may be removing name fields accidentally

acceptanceCriteria: Filtered order arrays contain complete order objects with all name fields
No data transformation during filtering removes or nullifies karigarName or genericName
Orders displayed after applying filters show correct names

requirements.text: Verify that RB order splitting logic (when marking orders as ready with supplied quantities) preserves karigarName and genericName in both original and newly created order records

quotes: Split RB orders based on supplied quantity
This filtering/splitting logic likely affected how order data flows to the dashboard components that display Karigar and generic names

acceptanceCriteria: When an RB order is split, both the updated original order and any new order records retain karigarName values
When an RB order is split, both the updated original order and any new order records retain genericName values
Split orders display names correctly in the dashboard after the split operation

constraints: Do not modify backend data structures or migration logic
Preserve existing order filtering and status update functionality
Do not change RB order splitting behavior except to fix name field preservation
nonGoals: Adding new name fields or changing name field data types
Modifying how names are initially populated during order ingestion
Changing dashboard layout or visual design
